p: Recently, the potential use of NPs as adjuvants in vaccines has been gaining interest. The inclusion of NPs in vaccine formulations has been reported to enhance antigen stability, 8, 9, 10 promote targeted antigen delivery, 11, 12 and assist slow release of antigens 13, 14 to eliminate the need for booster shots. 15, 16 Different NPs have been evaluated for their ability to deliver antigens and increase immune responses against influenza antigens in vaccines. The current review focuses on the latest scientific advancement in the application of different NPs in influenza subunit vaccine development to enhance immunogenicity (Table 2).
